resource.chars:
Report on Mr Lamarq’s Memoir on Attractions 
I have not read the whole of this memoir, but quite 
sufficient to convince me that is altogether 
unworthy of a place in the Transactions 
of the Royal Society. I need only refer 
to Article 17 to shew that he is ignorant of 
the most simple principles of mathematical 
reasoning in the action of forces: his subsequent 
experiments have no bearing on his principles.
I did not think it necessary to proceed farther 
in reading this paper 
George Peacock
